column2: Babygirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for menepause symptoms for about three weeks, I have no hot flashes or night sweats anymore, but i have gained alot of weight and retaining alot of fluid. And I work out 4 days a week, I dont like the weight gain and i seem sleepy alot to. I see my doc next week and I am going to see about changing medication. I was taking estroven which is an OTC drug for menepause and it to took away the hot flashes and night sweats without the weight gain, so im getting off the Enjuvia

column2: junebug, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started the lowest dose of enjuvia back in November 2011. It was effective but did not completely get rid of my hot flashes and from time to time, I still felt like I was in a fog. My Dr. increased the doage to .625 and I began having heart palpitations and still had hot flashes at night. My Dr. then took me off of it and prescribed an anti-depressant.  This caused me to have anxiety attacks. So, I am very unhappy with all of the treatments so far and the fact that my Dr. is not willing to test any of my hormone levels. I am switching to another Dr. and hope to have relief soon.

column2: Sherry in VA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 49 and had a complete hysterectomy in 2006. I had been taking Estratest, but it was causing an increase in facial hair so I asked my OB-GYN for something different. Within days of taking the Enjuvia my BP elevated, I had constant headaches and the issue I already have with an accelerated heart rate and PACs suddenly stopped responding to the medicine (Toprol) I was taking. After doubling up all the dosages and nothing working, the cardiologist was stumped. On my own, I stopped taking the Enjuvia and started the Estratest again from a leftover prescription. Wow! Immediate relief from the palpitations, BP and headaches. Sorry, Enjuvia is not for me. I'm asking to switch back to Estratest.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: sick, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: feel very sick

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was using Evamist for hot flashes and worked great! After palpitations primary doctor told me to stop it to rule out med. Went back on it but wasn't helping so started on low dose Enjuvia 2 weeks ago. Hot flashes mostly gone but feel dizzy occasionally, anxious and memory is awful. Thought was something else til read side effects and other reviews. Will give it another week.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Enjuvia .9 has helped somewhat with hot flashes, not entirely, but at this point I don't want to take a higher dose.  I have noticed some weight gain.

column2: Americana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was placed on this drug due to having all the menopausal symptoms that were driving me crazy and I wanted to be on something plant based, so my doctor put me on Enjuvia and Premarin.  It worked wonderful after one month; no more hot flashes, sex life improved, slept better.  BUT after 6 weeks I started bleeding and had to go off of it. My doctor offered to adjust the dose but said I would have to have a uterine biopsy first and I refused, as I didn't think it was necessary and was caused by the medication.  Wish I had not had bleeding with it or I would still take it.

column2: Ally, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dr prescribed Enjuvia when insurance would no longer pay for the Premarin I had been taking for over 20 years. I had a hysterectomy & oophorectomy at age 39 & had no problems with Premarin.  In the 2 months I have been taking Enjuvia, I cry easily, feel tired, sleep 2 to 3 hours longer each night, get hot flashes, & have diminished sex drive.  After reading other reviews, I finally made the connection between this med & the way I feel.  Thanks.

column2: Katzbee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on .45 dose for 3 weeks and have had good results.  The one side effect,so far, is imbalance. I can't call it dizziness but just crazy imbalance.  Wobbly and bumping into things.  My mind has cleared, I have more energy, and I'm not grumpy. I'll reserve judgement.  Maybe this minor issue will clear.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: Adverse event. I am a pharmacist/patient. Happily controlled hot flashes for approx. 8 months on Cenestin brand of estrogen (A) 0.625mg/day. This brand became unavailable and my gyn agreed with Medco to switch me to Enjuvia (estrogen B) 0.625mg/day. Approx. 2 weeks into Rx, developed intensely itchy, hivey rash on both shins, spreading to both forearms and slowly around my neck. Thought I would go out of my mind. Finally stopped the estrogen when I thought that might be the culprit and within 6 days, no new lesions, rash substantially better. Will probably be weeks before completely resolved. Needed oral prednisone 60mg/day, Rx and OTC antihistamines. Cenestin has since become available again and I'm deciding when to start retaking. Reported to this MedWatch (as a healthcare professional) as a probably side effect of Enjuvia.

column2: shellyz39@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am finally sleeping! It has also diminished my hot flashes.

column2: Karina, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My dr prescribed enjuvia for my horrible month long periods I was having due to the Emplenon a birth control located in my arm. My sex drive has decreased dramatically, my periods are normal now but I have so many other side effects like the nausea, headaches and breast tenderness, my dr has finally suggested I stay off of it for 3 months to see what happens.

column2: fed up, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy at 39. My doctor put me on premarin ;I'm 55 now. I felt great taking the premarin;In Jan.;the insurance co. did not want to pay the co-pay of premarin;put me on enjuvia and I am feeling horrible.I have terrible mood swings;feelings of confusion,don't sleep good at night,gaining weight;not myself at all.I called my doctor ;told her and I will pay for the premarin out of my pocket.I will not keep feeling like this.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: I had been taking Premarin for severe hot flashes and other symptoms of menopause.  It did not work very well even at the highest dose of 1.25mg.  The doctor switched me to Enjuvia and what a difference! I have no hot flashes anymore and feel like my old self again. I highly recommend it.

column2: countrygirl46, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: im 46 years old ive been taking this for 2 months ive been feeling better far as mood and feel happier but i have a few side effects  bloating , heartburn dizzyness i may have to change to something else

column2: AKAmaureen, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 25 and had a hysterectomy 2.5 years ago from stage 3 ovarian cancer. I have been on enjuvia since sometime around there.. and I hadnt noticed any problems with it, except they had to bump me up to 1.25 mg to keep the hot flashes and night sweats away. Recently I have noticed dizziness/lightheadedness.. I have had memory issues but had blamed that on the chemo.. and weight gain after about 3 months remission.. and that was supposably normal.. but then the weight plateaued and I gained more weight.. I am relatively active.. go to the gym 2 times a week and play occasional sports. I will be talking to my doctor about these symptoms.. my short term memory is HORRIBLE.. someone tells me something.. 10 seconds later I dont remember them telling me. I seem like a ditz.. and I definately am not.. so frustrating!

column2: Susan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just completed 3 months of Enjuvia .625 and prometrium 200 mg.It relieved hot flashes completely. Improved sleep and joint stiffness.  However the weight gain and bloating is not acceptable!  My dr. is now prescribing Activella.  I'm going to give it a try.  Sex drive is still low.  So frustrating!

column2: DonnaJay, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had stage 4 endometriosis, then had a radical hysterectomy 2 years ago and my doctor did not want me on any estrogen so as to starve any remaining endo in my body, so like a good girl, I struggled through the hot flashes and night sweats until I was about to go mad and begged her for something. That something was Enjuvia and it has worked for me.  It subdued my flashing and sweats very considerably and made my life so much more pleasant and bearable.  My doctor said that it is a mild dose of estrogen, not enough to cause problems for me with any endo still in my body but enough to calm down the menopause symptoms and she was right. I feel so much better and will continue on this therapy.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I switched from prempro .45 to enjuvia .45 with prometrium because doctor said it was more natural. I was on the same dose but night sweats and anxiety came back with a vengence. The same dose did not work and I dont agree that it is more natural. She wanted to increase dose but I switched back to prempro .45 since I dont want a higher dose. Also, one copay instead of two is better. Enjuvia did not work for me. I gave it two weeks.

column2: Theo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy but I still have my ovaries.  I have not noticed any change at all and I don't even know if should take it if I dont have any menopause symptoms

column2: 30SurgicalMenopause, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I tried Premarin for about 3 weeks and switched due to extreme itchiness. I have been on this Enjuvia for 2 years. The first year I took it everyday and felt great! This past year I thought I didn't need it, so I skipped days here and there- I have noticed that on the days I don't take it I am crabby and can't sleep at night. I am concerned with the effects of long-term use though.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Premarin .3 but switched to Enjuvia .3 for cheaper copays.  Enjuvia works well for my menopause but I am more depressed and my thinking is sluggish.  I may switch back to Premarin.

column2: susan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on this med for 10 days and my hot flashes are gone.  I haven't gained any weight.  Joint stiffness is better.  I'm also taking prometrium.

column2: Nikitta30, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a full hysterectomy 4 and half years ago when I was 39...have tried many different things for my hot flashes and night sweats and severe headaches...I have been on Enjuvia (now 0.45, but was in a higher dosage) and although it stopped the hotflashes, and the others, the side effects are killing me!  I have vertigo...severe low blood sugar moments when I pass out...trouble sleeping and weight gain. I'm afraid to stop taking it though...can't handle the hot flashes...help!

column2: hystemom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have tried almost every type of estrogen possible, including compounded bioidenticals, and nothing has even come close to working for me like Enjuvia. It has resolved all of the issues I have dealt with in the years following my hysterectomy.

column2: aubrey123, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Wow within three days of .03mg a day the lowest dose I got my life back unbelievable

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
grandma3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking enjuvia for a year now and i couldn't do without it. no hot flashes , no night sweats, no weight gain. i have regular checkups and everything is GREAT :)

column2: Montana, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on enjuvia for 1 year after taking premerin for a very long time. I have had a few hot flashes, not bad, but was not bothered with them before. I was wondering if anyone had notice joint pain after taking Enjuvia?  My elbows and knee joints hurt.

column2: Marsha, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Enjuvia for just a week and not only have I not had the hot flashes, but I can actually breath better!?  How is that?  I love it!  I experienced this same breathing experience when I went to San Franscisco.  I get up rested in the mornings.  I actually get up before my alarm goes off not.  I'm hope it helps me get words out of my mouth.

column2: stef, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my energy is back. i smile again. i dont feel so anxious. bloating and breast pain have subsided and this is at day 6. my pants fit like they used to 4 months ago.

column2: kazzy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I've been taking the 1.25mg for about 6mos and found it to be excellent for my night sweats. My negative is weight gain without changing my diet and I workout 5 days a week. Also, my mammograms have changed from normal to cloudy/fatty in one breast. Doctor recommend slowly going off the pills.

column2: applechiles, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it had helped with my menopause.

column2: msCinD, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Enjuvia was added to my current medication Estrace. My hot flashes were so severe I couldnt function. After 2 weeks my hot flashes are gone and I can finally sleep. Ive had no side effects.

column2: lizzie123, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Enjuvia for 2-yrs. I had a total hysterecotomy, and was placed on this hormone replacement drug 6-weeks after surgery.  I've had some headaches, but minor.  I take .0625 mg every other day.  I do not take this drug daily.  I am going to go for my annual checkup in 3 weeks, and will see if it is feasible to reduce the mg. or see when I'll be able to go off of the drug.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I am 51 and have been on Enjuvia for two years following a complete hysterectomy. Over the past six months...I am having symptoms of dimensia.  It states in the prescription cautions that this could be a side effect.  I am worried and currently going through testing.  BEWARE LADIES!!!!  Dimensia is no joke.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It has helped with hot flashes but that is about the only thing it has helped. I have been on this medication for two years and I am starting to get a rash on my face,hands and arms.

column2: Berryfood, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started to have hot flashes, mood swings, sleepness nights so my doctor put me on Enjuvia.  After 6 weeks of use, no more hot flashes, but the mood swings are soooo much worse. One minute I am Mother Teresa and the next minute Hitler.  Not a good feeling.  Also have been gaining weight.  Overall, do not like.  I may try a spray that a friend of mine uses.  Think it is Eva or something with that name.  Hope this helps.

column2: Mishod822@aol.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was experiencing severe hot flashes, was put on enjuvia.  Had partial hysterectomy, leaving my ovaries...apparently ovaries kicked back in working giving me symptoms of pregnancy.  Went off for 3 months, hot flashes continued.  Went back on for 4 months and symptoms returned - just stopped taking 10 days ago, but have been feeling nausea, flu like symptoms, horrible mood swings....don't know if it is worth it.  anyone know another way to treat hot flashes?

column2: fefe, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 35yrs old and was put on Enjuvia 1.25 years after having a hystorectomy. At first the drug was working fine, then after 2 weeks I begin to gain weight without changing my diet.  I was having a hard time concentrating.  I was unbelievably horny all the time, so much so that it was embarassing. I had a severe break out of acne.  The list goes on but most of the side effects listed on webmd I experienced.  Over all I gained 30lbs in less than a month.

column2: sammie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug almost 2 years now, and it is super for treating hot flashes.  I take 1.25 dosage, and have tried the .625, but hot flashes returned with lower dose. The only problem I have is that it makes me retain fluid.

column2: jb64, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 44 year old with high blood pressure and overwieght. I have had a complete hysterectomy for endometriosis and started out on enjuvia 1.25 mg and cannot even tell that i have lost all my female parts except  for the scar across my stomach. No side effects as of yet but have only been on the pill for 2 months. So far it has been great. Hope to see it stay this way as i have heard many horror stories.

column2: MISSY, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: AFTER HAVING EVERYTHING REMOVED DUE TO MEDICAL CONDITIONS AT 35 AND BEEN ON SEVERAL DIFFERENT HORMONE REPLACEMENTS, MY DR PUT ME ON THIS MED. I HAVE BEEN TAKING IT FOR ABOUT 2 YEAR. NOW ALL THE SUDDEN I HAVE BEEN FILLING ILL (FLU LIKE SX, DIZZINESS, NAUSEA STOMACH PROBLEMS, MIGRAINES, ETC, LOTS OF TESTS. MY PCP DID SOME RESEARCH, NOW BELIEVE I HAVE DEVELOPED AN ALLERGY TO THE MED? I WILL BE OFF IT FOR 10 DAYS TO CONFIRM. I DON'T KNOW WHAT I'M GOING TO DO KNOW. IM YOUNG, AND AFRAID I WILL BE A MESS.

column2: renee457, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: after using depo inj. for 2yrs. i just wanted to change back to a pill. due to being easier.was onit 1month. felt like i now have deminteia. unable to think stright, remembering things very hard.worked for hot flashes, but other side affects are not worth it. gone back to depo inj. 1mon. still no better. not sure if this has anything to do with this med. but ask questions before you leave your doctor.

column2: dee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It controls hot flashes but I have already had an abnormal mammogram after just 4 months of being on this medication. I also seem to get dizzy quite a bit. It makes my urine blue green.

column2: Blondie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has not helped me at all with relief of systoms of menopause.  Very unhappy with this drug.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication due to abnormal periods and heavy prolonged bleeding. I don't believe this medication is good for these problems. column9: Vaginal dischargemood swings

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
